sources.args: xcb xcb-shm xcb-sync xcb-xfixes xcb-randr xcb-image xcb-keysyms xcb-icccm xcb-shape

debug_and_release.description: Compile libs in debug and release mode

force_debug_info.description: Add debug info in release mode

simulator_and_device.description: Build for both simulator and device

rtti.comment: mkspecs/features/win32/default_pre.prf sets no-rtti. Follow default behavior of configure.exe by overriding with rtti.

dbus-linked.description: Qt D-Bus directly linked to libdbus

msvc_mp.description: Use multiple processors when compiling with MSVC

static_runtime.description: Statically link the C/C++ runtime library

wmf-backend.description: Windows Media Foundation backend for Qt Multimedia

extra_features.comment: ### remove, once qfeatures.txt is ported to the new system

earlyReport.message:
-debug-and-release is only supported on Darwin and Windows platforms.
Qt can be built in release mode with separate debug information, so
-debug-and-release is no longer necessary.
debug-only framework builds are not supported. Configure with -no-framework if you want a pure debug build.
XCB plugin requires libxkbcommon. See -qt-xkbcommon-x11 and -system-xkbcommon-x11.
This platform does not support RPATH

report.message:
Using static linking will disable the use of dynamically
loaded plugins. Make sure to import all needed static plugins,
or compile needed modules into the library.

journald, syslog or slog2 integration is enabled.
If your users intend to develop applications against this build,
ensure that the IDEs they use either set QT_LOGGING_TO_CONSOLE to 1
or are able to read the logged output from journald, syslog or slog2.

Qt does not support compiling the Oracle database driver with
MinGW, due to lack of such support from Oracle. Consider disabling the
Oracle driver, as the current build will most likely fail.

No QPA platform plugin enabled! This will
produce a Qt that cannot run GUI applications.
The dependencies needed for xcb to build are listed in
src/plugins/platforms/xcb/README

Qt is using double for qreal on this system. This is binary-incompatible against Qt 5.1.
Configure with '-qreal float' to create a build that is binary-compatible with 5.1.

Could not find XKB config root, use -xkb-config-root to set a path to
XKB configuration data. This is required for keyboard input support.

When linking against OpenSSL, you can override the default
library names through OPENSSL_LIBS.
For example:
    OPENSSL_LIBS='-L/opt/ssl/lib -lssl -lcrypto' ./configure -openssl-linked
The [-no]-qpa-platform-guard argument is deprecated and has no effect.
Accessibility disabled. This configuration of Qt is unsupported.

Using OpenGL ES 2.0 on Windows without ANGLE.
The build will most likely fail.
Specify -opengl desktop to use regular OpenGL.
Disabling Linux Accessibility Bridge: D-Bus is missing.
On OS X, AAT is supported only with -qt-harfbuzz.

The OpenGL functionality tests failed!
You might need to modify the include and library search paths by editing QMAKE_INCDIR_OPENGL[_ES2],
QMAKE_LIBDIR_OPENGL[_ES2] and QMAKE_LIBS_OPENGL[_ES2] in the mkspec for your platform.

Your C library does not provide sscanf_l or snprintf_l.
You need to use libdouble-conversion for double/string conversion.

detected a std::atomic implementation that fails for function pointers.
Please apply the patch corresponding to your Standard Library vendor, found in
  qtbase/config.tests/common/atomicfptr
Qt requires a compliant STL library.

entries.args: avx512f avx512er avx512cd avx512pf avx512dq avx512bw avx512vl avx512ifma avx512vbmi
